Project Name: Construction of Civil Transit Facility and Allied Facilities at Danna Mali (SM Hill) Tangdhar.
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Organization Street: 7 RR Bn Punjab c/o 56 APO PIN 934507
Project Description: The Chowkibal-Tangdhar-Chamkot (CTC) road serves as the lifeline of Tangdhar town and the surrounding villages. This road extensively is used by civilians for commuting;throughout the year. However, it remains vulnerable to disruptions due to landslides during monsoons and avalanches during winters, particularly as it traverses Nasta Chun Pass at an altitude of 10,020 ft. Given the security dynamics of the region, the movement of individuals and vehicles along this road requires deliberate checks and monitoring. In this regard, the Battalion has been actively engaged in providing administrative,  medical, safety, and security support to travellers along this crucial axis. Thus, the project planned will provide security check, medical facilities, night stay facility, convenience, food and vehicle repair facility to the civilian and military personal. To enhance these facilities, it is imperative to construct and equip a Civil Transit Facility along with Allied Facilities there.

Project Description: The Proposed Road takes off from Kanyal Gali at a distance of 20 Km away from District Headquarters. The road shall benefit about 5000 souls. The road shall connect 04 Nos villages namely Kanyal Gali, Nagli Kass Kote Jabbar. Kakora Upper and its adjoining hamlets. The main economic activity of public is agriculture, cattle rearing & Para forces.;;          The Terrain of the road is hilly and passes through a large number of bed crossings. The inhabitants of the area earn their livelihood mainly by growing crops, vegetable and dairy products. The area is rich in dairy produce and is carried to nearby area of Rajouri and its surroundings. This makes the road even more important for the farmer of the area to establish their business and improve their living standard. Under this purview project is sanctioned under NABARD RIDF XXVIII.;;Diversion of forest land enroute the alignment is the only viable option and is unavoidable and barest minimum forest area has been proposed for diversIon

Project Name: Construction of road from Patra to Moonga wali Gali via Primary School Moonga Wali Gali
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Project Description: The Proposed Road takes off from Mubarakpura Sohana road at a distance of 10 Km away from District Headquarters. The road shall benefit about 5000 souls. The road shall connect 04 Nos villages namely Gabri Mohra, Naha, Mober Mal Gura and its adjoining hamlets. The main economic activity of public is agriculture, cattle rearing & Para forces. The Terrain of the road is hilly and passes through a large number of bed crossings. The inhabitants of the area earn their livelihood mainly by growing crops, vegetable and dairy products. The area is rich in dairy produce and is carried to nearby area of Rajouri and its surroundings. This makes the road even more important for the farmer of the area to establish their business and improve their living standard. Under this purview project is sanctioned under NABARD RIDF XXVIII.;Diversion of forest land enroute the alignment is the only viable option and is unavoidable and barest minimum forest area has been proposed for diversion, jointly verified

Project Name: Transmission system for evacuation of power from Pakal Dul (1000 MW), Kiru (624 MW) and Kwar (540 MW) HEPs of CVPPL
Alternative Site Examined: YES
Organization Street: Chenab Jal Shakti Bhawan, Opp Saraswati Dham, Rail Head Complex, Jammu-180012
Project Description: The Transmission system for evacuation of power from  Pakul Dul (1000 MW), Kiru (624 MW) and Kwar (540 MW) was identified as part of a master plan of Central Electricity Authority (CEA) for evacuation of power from HEPs in Chenab Basin in J&K and Himachal Pradesh considering various generation projects in Chenab Basin and RoW constraints. In that master plan, it has been proposed that a 400 kV D/c (Triple HTLS Conductor - equivalent to the current carrying capacity of 2300 MW) line would be constructed from Kiru HEP to Kishtwar Pooling station (High capacity Common Corridor-II), one circuit of which would be LILO (Line-in Line-out) at Kwar HEP and PakalDul HEP.  Accordingly,  this transmission line project is being taken up by Chenab Valley Power Projects Limited (CVPPL).

Project Name: Expansion of Cement Plant capacity from 3.3 Lakhs TPA to 6.6 Lakhs TPA and clinker production from 3.135 Lakh TPA to 6.27 Lakh TPA by M/s Trumboo Industries Pvt. Ltd. (TIPL)
Plot Nos: Village- Khrew, Tehsil-Pampore, District- Pulwama, UT- Jammu & Kashmir
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: The proposed project will be installed in the existing land area of 12.38 ha with existing operational plant, there shall be no addition of land for the proposed expansion. Also, the site has well laid access to roads and is in near vicinity to the Pampore- Zantrang Road which is connected to NH-44, easy accessibility raw material and exporters of finished products, electricity supply, fuel, water, transportation network drainage system
Plot Number: Village- Khrew, Tehsil-Pampore, District- Pulwama, UT- Jammu & Kashmir
Project Description: Trumboo Industries Private Limited (TIPL) is presently operating a cement plant having a cement and clinker capacity of 3.3 Lakhs TPA & 3.135 Lakhs TPA respectively to produce ordinary portland cement in an area of 12.38 ha. TIPL has decided to expand the cement manufacturing capacity in the existing plant area by adding another manufacturing line of 3.3 Lakhs TPA to produce 6.6 Lakhs TPA OPC. The expansion of the proposed project will be within the existing plot area only, no additional land is required for the expansion.;The project falls under category B1 of Schedule 3(b) as per EIA notification 2006 and its subsequent amendments as the capacity of the proposed cement plant is less than 1 MTPA. The project attracts general conditions.;

Project Name: Establishment of Himalayan High Altitude Atmospheric and Climatic Research Station for Atmospheric and Climatic Measurements at Village Mandlote, Patni Top, Udhampur.
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: Selected site is fit for Aerosol-Cloud study. It is above 2000 m enabling free troposphere measurements and is free from natural (trees,hill etc)/anthropogenic obstruction thus experiences active cloud movement across the ridge. It is away from any kind of pollution hotspot to ensure unbiased study. Container will be lifted by a crane, therefore site needs to be adjacent to road. Other sites were also surveyed by the team but couldnt qualify to given conditions and were found unsuitable.
Organization Street: Central University of Jammu, Rahya Suchani, Bagla
Project Description: The Purpose of the Project is to establish a Facility for Obtaining the Atmospheric and Climatic Measurement by establishing a Laboratory at the hill at village Mandlote, Patni Top Udhampur by Central University of Jammu. A total of 0.238 hectares of Forest Land is involved. The land at such a high Altitude is required since High Altitude is essential requirement to study Aerosol-cloud interactions and Micro Physical properties of Clouds. The site is chosen as it is above 2000 m to enable free troposphere measurements so that aerosol-cloud studies can be conducted and is away from any kind of pollution hotspot to ensure unbiased study.;;We hereby also clarify that no major construction activity is going to take place on the site. Initially, a levelled foundation will be made to place the pre-fabricated container. Later, only two single storey 40 x 20 feet structures will be made for lab and meeting purpose. So, you are requested to waive off from submitting geologist report.

Project Name: Development, Operation and Maintenance of Ropeway from SDA parking area to Shankaracharya temple in Srinagar, Jammu & Kashmir for Eco-Tourism purpose.
Alternative Site Examined: YES
Project Description: The proposed project is development of ropeway from SDA parking area to Shankaracharya temple. The total length of the ropeway is 1050 m. Two stations along with 6 lattice/Tubular tower are proposed on the ropeway alignment. A Mono Cable Detachable Grip Gondola system is proposed with a final capacity of 700 PPHD. The operating speed shall be 5 m/s and travel time shall be 5.31 mins. The total number of carriers shall be 15, having a capacity of 8 people. The proposed ropeway project shall be accommodated within 16m RoU. About 0.4449 Hectare of Reserved Forest notify under Forest Protection Act 1980 shall be affected by the proposed ropeway project including the stations. The proposed ropeway would support the access to the cave by reducing the travel time from approx. 90 minutes of walk to ~5.31 minutes between the two stations and provide a comfortable journey free from the influence of the weather.

Project Name: Expansion of Cement Plant capacity from 3.3 Lakhs TPA to 6.6 Lakhs TPA and clinker production from 3.135 Lakh TPA to 6.27 Lakh TPA by M/s Trumboo Industries Pvt. Ltd. (TIPL)
Plot Nos: Village- Khrew, Tehsil-Pampore, District- Pulwama, UT- Jammu & Kashmir
Alternative Site Examined: NO
Alternative Site Description: The proposed project will be installed in the existing land area of 12.38 ha with existing operational plant, there shall be no addition of land for the proposed expansion. Also, the site has well laid access to roads and is in near vicinity to the Pampore- Zantrang Road which is connected to NH-44, easy accessibility raw material and exporters of finished products, electricity supply, fuel, water, transportation network drainage system
Plot Number: Village- Khrew, Tehsil-Pampore, District- Pulwama, UT- Jammu & Kashmir
Project Description: Trumboo Industries Private Limited (TIPL) is presently operating a cement plant having a cement and clinker capacity of 3.3 Lakhs TPA & 3.135 Lakhs TPA respectively to produce ordinary portland cement in an area of 12.38 ha. TIPL has decided to expand the cement manufacturing capacity in the existing plant area by adding another manufacturing line of 3.3 Lakhs TPA to produce 6.6 Lakhs TPA OPC. The expansion of the proposed project will be within the existing plot area only, no additional land is required for the expansion.;The project falls under category B1 of Schedule 3(b) as per EIA notification 2006 and its subsequent amendments as the capacity of the proposed cement plant is less than 1 MTPA. The project attracts general conditions.;

Project Name: Distributed Snowpack modelling, Real Time Avalanche Monitoring and Autonomous EarlyWarning System-AVALINE
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Project Description: DGRE issues daily avalanche warnings/forecasting for the troops and civil;population residing in the snowbound areas of Indian Himalaya during winter.;The accuracy of forecast highly depends on the snow and meteorological data;collected from the field locations. Moreover, timely detection of snow;avalanche occurrence helps in hazard management related issues. In this;direction DGRE has taken up a new project to monitor and model snow;avalanche phenomenon by developing an Integrated Avalanche Monitoring;System (lAMS) along Sonamarg-Zozila (s-z) axis and Chowkibal-Tangdhar (CT);axis with following objectlve " Development of real-time avalanche;monitoring systems for avalanche affected transportation corridors using a;combination of infrasonic sensor network, geophone sensor network and;Doppler based avalanche detection radar.

Project Name: Diversion of Forest Land for Development, Operation and Maintenance of Ropeway from SDA parking area to Shankaracharya temple in Srinagar, Jammu & Kashmir
Alternative Site Examined: YES
Organization Street: NHLML, Bays No. 35-28, Sector-4, Panchkula, Chandigarh
Organization Legal Status: Central PSU (eg. NHAI, AAI, NTP, CIL, SAIL)
Project Description: The proposed project is development of ropeway from SDA parking area to Shankaracharya temple. The total length of the ropeway is 1050m. Two stations along with 6 lattice/Tubular tower are proposed on the ropeway alignment. A Mono Cable Detachable Grip Gondola system is proposed with a final capacity of 700 PPHD. The operating speed shall be 5 m/s and travel time shall be 5.31 mins. The total number of carriers shall be 15, having a capacity of 8 people. The proposed ropeway project shall be accommodated within 16m RoU. About 1.6977 Hectare of Reserved Forest notify under Forest Protection Act 1980 shall be affected by the proposed ropeway project including the stations.

Project Description: The proposed campus of IIT Jammu will be completed in phased manner, the masterplan is consisting of 2 stages: Phase A and Phase B.;Phase A has 3Stages: 1A, 1B, and 1CTransit stage 1A & 1B is already constructed and in operational. Existing stage 1A has engineering block, Hostel & guest house along with central dome, while Phase 1 B has transit hostel and transit housing.;However, Stage 1C is planned to be constructed. In Stage 1C additional 4 buildings will be built supplement to the already approved building blocks. Earlier IIT Jammu had obtained Environment Clearance from SEIAA JK under proposal no. SIA/JK/MIS/55741/2019 and was awarded the environment clearance under file no. KJEIAA/2020/319/1274-82 dated 13.11.2020;

Project Description: Said Ladi takes off from Vehji Canal at RD 3770 mtr. The canal is under the maintenance and upkeep of Irrigation Sub Division Shopian. The total length of main canal is more than 8000 mtr and irrigates horticultural land in about 11 villages from Gund Hadoo upto Amshipora village. The canal is mainly in earthen shape at present. This project covers the construct cement lining at critical sections of the canal and its branches, in order to maintain adequate discharge during the peak season. It also involves construction of 02 number flumes at RD 4700 mtr and RD 6205 mtr of the canal.

Project Name: Distributed Snowpack modelling, Real Time Avalanche Monitoring and Autonomous Early Warning System-AVALINE
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Project Description: DGREissues daily avalanche warnings/forecasting for the troops and civil;population residing in the snowbound areas of Indian Himalaya during winter.;The accuracy of forecast highly depends on the snow and meteorological data;collected from the field locations. Moreover, timely detection of snow;avalanche occurrence helps in hazard management related issues. In this;direction DGREhas taken up a new project to monitor and model snow;avalanche phenomenon by developing an Integrated Avalanche Monitoring;System (lAMS) along Sonamarg-Zozila (s-z) axis and Chowkibal-Tangdhar (C-;T) axis with following objective * Development of real-time avalanche;monitoring systems for avalanche affected transportation corridors using a;combination of infrasonic sensor network, geophone sensor network and;Doppler based avalanche detection radar.

Organization Street: Geological Survey of India(GSI), yard no. 2, Transport Nagar, Narwal, Jammu. 180006
Project Description: As a follow up surface samples have to be collected for beneficiation studies for the previously drilled 25 sites by making pits. The dimension of pits will be maximum 3m x 3m x 3m and the samples will be collected by making groove of 10cm width from top to bottom of the pit. Samples will be collected by employing JCB at each drillhole site. The work component involves sampling as a part of survey and mineral prospecting norms of GSI. After the collection of sample from each location, the excavated trenches will be back filled by the excavated material. In the similar manner, a maximum of 25nos. of locations can be targeted for sample collection so that representative sample of the entire studied block can be taken up.  Out of 25 locations, 19 nos. occur in forest land while as other 6 points fall in non-forest land. The sampling will not involve any mining activity, clearing of forest area or cutting/felling of trees, damage to any public or local structure.;

Project Description: The Water Supply Scheme  DONGROO has been framed to cover the cost for providing BIS standard quality compliant potable water to each household of Panchayat Dongroo , block : Gundna and its adjoining hamlets at the rate of 55 LPCD , through functional household tap water connections to be executed under the  flagship programme of Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM).  The main scope of the project involves creation of sustainable water source by tapping new water source from higher contours to cater the water demand for intermediate and ultimate design periods.  The project involves laying of gravity pipelines, construction of surface reservoirs, sedimentation tanks , filtration plants .The operation and maintenance of the water supply scheme shall be carried out by Gram Panchayat or its designated agency such as VWSC etc. The project is designed to serve the design population of 3660 souls at the end of the design period.The ultimate requirement of the water at the end of design period

Organization Street: Office of the Executive Engineer ,Jal Shakti (PHE) Division Doda
Project Description: The Water Supply Scheme Thalela  has been framed to cover the cost for providing BIS standard quality compliant potable water to each household of  Block: Chiralla and its adjoining hamlets at the rate of 55 LPCD , through functional household tap water connections to be executed under the  flagship programme of Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM).  The main scope of the project involves creation of sustainable water source by tapping new water source from higher contours to cater the water demand for intermediate and ultimate design periods.  The project involves laying of gravity pipelines, construction of surface reservoirs, sedimentation tanks , filtration plants .The operation and maintenance of the water supply scheme shall be carried out by Gram Panchayat or its designated agency such as VWSC etc.The project is designed to serve the design population of 3660 souls at the end of the design period.The ultimate requirement of the water at the end of design period

Project Description: In order to enhance border defence mechanism and strengthen anti-infiltration grid, MHA (GOI) has sanctioned establishment of various Border Police Posts (BPPs) in the immediate hinterland along LOC in UT (J&K). One such BPP has been sanctioned by MHA (GOI) vide letter No.13030/8/2022-S(JKL) dated 22-06-2022 read with PHQ J&K No.BD/GC-285(2022)/2291-2301 dated 24-06-2022 for Hafrada. Haflrada forms the part of immediate hinterland of LOC. The proposed BPP at Hafrada is thus the strategic as it falls on the traditional infiltration route. Establishment of BPP Hafrada in the fringes of Kehmil Forest Division is thus extremely necessary for curbing infiltration from across the border.

Project Name: Capacity Enhancement of Common Effluent Treatment Plants (CETPs) from 600 KLD to 1100KLD with provision of Captive SLF located at Industrial Growth Centre, Lassipora, Phase II, District Pulwama, J & K by Jammu & Kashmir State Industries Development Corporation (J&K SIDCO)
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Project Description: The existing common effluent treatment plant (CETP) has been established at IGC, Lassipora for treatment of effluents, mainly from the tanneries but it also treats other effluents such as trade wastewater from Dairy, bone crushing units etc. The designed capacity of the CETP was 600 m3/d, 40-50% being the present capacity utilization.;Now, it is estimated that an additional module of CETP of 500m3/d is required for this purpose, increasing the total treatment capacity to 1100 m3/d.;The treated effluent will be discharged to the Rambir Nallah which remains dry all over the years. The BOD/COD will be kept within the limits before discharge to the water bodies as per CPCB guidelines.

Project Description: The Water Supply Scheme Southa has been framed to cover the cost for providing BIS standard quality compliant potable water to each household of panchayat Southa  , Block  Bhalla and its adjoining hamlets at the rate of 55 LPCD , through functional household tap water connections to be executed under the  flagship programme of Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM).  The main scope of the project involves creation of sustainable water source by tapping new water source from higher contours to cater the water demand for intermediate and ultimate design periods.  The project involves laying of gravity pipelines, construction of surface reservoirs, sedimentation tanks , filtration plants .The operation and maintenance of the water supply scheme shall be carried out by Gram Panchayat or its designated agency such as VWSC etc.The ultimate requirement of the water at the end of design period.

Divisional ;commisioner Jammu has accorded sanction to the transfer of land in the ;said village in favour of Industries & Commerce Department, J&K ;Government for establishment of Industrial Estate. The land has been ;identified and handed over to SICOP by Director Industries & commerce ;Jammu for development of Industrial Estate. The topography of the ;proposed site is semi hilly terrain and is 20 kms away from Tehsil Bari ;Brahmana. The road leading to site is black topping having 7.0 meters width. ;The population surrounding the area is approximately 9850 souls. The ;Government of J&K is keen to develop Industrial Estate in the area thus ;creating job opportunities to the local youth of the area. Land area is around 154 Kanal.11 No. Units has been registered in the said area.;To develop the area with road pavement and drain surrounding the area, Forest clearance is required at the identified location.

Project Description: In order to enhance border defence mechanism and strengthen anti-filtration grid, Ministry of Home Affairs has sanctioned various Border Polic Posts (BPP) in the immediate hinterland along LOC, one such BPP for Bungus being sanctioned vide MHA (GOI) letter No.13030/8/2022-S(JKL) dated 22-06-2022 read with PHQ J&K No.BD/GC-285(2022)/2291-2301 dated 24-06-2022. Bungus Valley being entirely forest land falls within the vicinity of LOC and is highly strategic from infiltration point of view. Establishment of BPP Bungus in the fringes of Bungus Valley is thus extremely necessary and of high strategic importance to curtail infiltration effectively. A chunk of 07 (Seven) kanals of treeless forest land with existing approach road already identified and earmarked at location GR-34.377532, 74.038061 is proposed to be transferred to J&K Police for construction of said BPP. The construction shall be in strict conformity with the guidelines laid down by ECC /Ministry of Environment & Forests.

Project Description: The Project involves the construction of New 2x10 MVA, 33/11 kV Receiving Station for Central University of Jammu, Bagla, Samba along with erection of 17.08 KM of 33 kV Line with ASCR Panther Conductor on 13 mtr ST Poles & self supporting structures from 132/33 kV Grid Station Bari Brahamana-II to new 2x10 MVA, 33/11 kV Receiving Station for Central University. The new receiving station shall cater the load of Central University of Jammu. A section of this 33 kV Power Line passes through the forest area inside the closures and since the under construction 33 kV Line is on 13 Mtr long ST Poles, there is no danger to the Environment. Further, no construction of Retaining/ Breast walls is involved in the area. The Project is of prime importance as it is being monitored by PM Office and needs early completion thereof.

Project Description: The Water Supply Scheme Zagote Chakra has been framed to cover the cost for providing BIS standard quality compliant potable water to each household of panchayat Phagsoo A  , block Thatri and its adjoining hamlets at the rate of 55 LPCD , through functional household tap water connections .The main scope of the project involves creation of sustainable water source by tapping new water source from higher contours to cater the water demand for intermediate and ultimate design periods .The project involves laying of gravity pipelines , construction of surface reservoirs , sedimentation tanks , filtration plants .The operation and maintenance of the water supply scheme shall be carried out by Gram Panchayat or its designated agency such as VWSC etc. ;The Water Supply Scheme Zagote Chakra is designed for the ultimate population of 1587 souls projected in 2051 . At present the scheme will cater the demands of 720 souls .Accordingly 114 number of households at present will be benefitted.

Organization Name: EXECUTIVE ENGINEER IRRIGATION AND FC DIVISION BARAMULLA
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Project Description: It is proposed to lift 12 cusecs of water from river Jhelum through pumping units and deliver the supplies through a rising main into deliver tank present at location of Gantmulla Colony on the left side of NH 1. This rising main is part of erstwhile LIS Gantmulla project having main canal also part of it. This old scheme has failed to deliver the demands of public and for this reason new Gantmulla project is proposed which will also carry irrigated to uncovered agriculture fields. Supply from delivery tank is proposed to move under gravity through established network of main Canal. On this main canal, Stage II having pumping units 3.50 Cusecs is proposed to lift irrigation water to Sarband delivery tank at GantmullaBalaWater from this delivery tank is proposed to be carried in delivery pipes up to the farthest point of delivery.

Project Description: During rainy season in 2021, there is sinking/ Land Sliding in the area adjoining Tower no. 48 and Tower No 54. Due to Land Sliding/ Sinking both the Towers are deformed and under heavy stress. Temporary safety measures have been taken at site for saving the Towers from Collapse and consequent outage of transmission line leading to Loss of Power Generation and Power Supply to J&K State. For safe and reliable operation of Transmission Line shifting of affected Tower is necessary to safer place. Hence, diversion of 132 kV D/C Sewa-II to Hiranagar Transmission Line is necessary for Safe operation of National Grid Power Grid Corporation of India Limited (A Govt of India Enterprise) is Transmission Licensee under the India Electricity Act 2003.

Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Project Description: The existing   water supply scheme is supplying water to 495 households. The existing system being designed on a supply rate of 10-30 LPCD falls short of meeting the demands of public. Besides, there has been tremendous increase in population as well as living standard of public which has resulted in additional load on the existing system. The old scheme for the area is outlived and the pipe network is deteriorated, thereby leading to water losses at number of spots. Moreover, the area is mostly populated by Gujars who are sparsely scattered over the patis having huge contour difference. The off take point of the scheme is at Tatjen nallah which is nearly 15kms away in deep forests of Sedew where snow depths is nearly 8feet and its maintenance during times of disruption is problematic. To sort out such issue, Construction of impounding reservoir with 10 days detention period is proposed.;
